name: Handumon MPA
notes: Identifying species, photographing, snorkel

name: Handumon MPA
notes: Orientation dive and practice survey

name: Bungan-Diyot
notes: At recommendation of Caubyan Baranguy captain

name: Caubyan East
notes: south edge of Caubyan Reef

name: Caubyan West
notes: north edge of Caubyan Reef

name: Mahanay East
notes: Silt below 6m. Seaweed farm adjacent.

name: Tahong Tahong
notes: First collection trip!

name: Tahong Tahong
notes: First collection trip!

name: Handumon MPA
notes: Visibility was terrible.

name: Looc
notes: GPS battery died part-way through (missed last 18 min)

name: Looc Tigib
notes: Surveyed and collected until 11:27, then spent more time searching for PRBI (found no more). NOT a randomly selected site

name: Bunga-billa
notes: Searching for PRBI, MLP recorded ENQD and inhabiting spp

name: Jean Pierre
notes: Searching for PRBI, MLP recorded ENQD and inhabiting spp, but MLP forgot to mark which PRBI were found by GS and not on the transect

name: Pasil
notes: Santander survey (actually, 1km short). Forgot to turn on GPS, so drove boat back over track 16:30 to 16:45. Also marked waypoints at endpoints (�Santander2� and �Santander3�)

name: Poblacion Argao MPA
notes: GPS battery died at the end, so I added a waypoint named �Argao1� as we organized gear. We had likely floated a bit since the end of our suvey when I made the waypoint. I began recording habitat data every 10 min (% cover in a armspan circle)

name: Tulic MPA
notes: Recorded habitat data every 10 min

name: Casay MPA
notes: GPS appears not to have worked, so circled tacot with boat 15:31 to ? (before 15:35) with GPS#1

name: Arbor MPA 1
notes: Began noting sygnathids for Kerrie. GS and MLP recording depth. GS depths are console depths (add 3 ft to what's on the datasheet)

name: Arbor MPA 2
notes: Chosen because in sanctuary, but happens to overlap the survey site. GS depths are console depths (added 3 ft. to what's on the data sheet)

name: Arbor Outside
notes: getting dark! GS depths are console depths (added 3 ft to what's on the data sheet)

name: North Granada MPA
notes: GS depths are now actual depths. We swam almost the entire sanctuary.

name: North Granada Outside
notes: Dive entered and ended on area of sand/seagrass and very sparse/poor coral. Started in front of a resort owned by an American.

name: Ely Point
notes: Dive ended when we began to overlap with Arbor MPA 1 survey

name: Macatol
notes: Trashed reef, lots of Diadema urchins, many blast fishers here

name: Goc-ong
notes: Better coral than Macatol, but fewer anemonefish

name: Demi
notes: Lots of plastic in the water. Many comb jellies. APCL very skittish.

name: Macatol 2
notes: Still 0.8 km south of Survey Location, but further north puts us on sand flats or into Talisay. We are north of our Macatol survey site.

name: Katongan
notes: Ended in a thunderstorm and downpour!

name: Lobog
notes: Poor visibility! Lobog means �not clear�

name: Oca�a
notes: Difficult navigation: went in a circle at one point. Many seaweed farms. This is a proposed sanctuary.

name: Bonbon
notes: Decent amount of live coral. GPS not on? Turned on when finished, ~14:50 (to get pointlat/long for transect)

name: Abogon
notes: Had to stop a bit north of actual survey site because it would have put us in Sibonga. MANY seaweed farms made navigation very difficult, particularly at beginning of transect when we were too deep to see the lines. MLP tangled often at beginning (distracted from survey).

name: Lauis Bantayan 1
notes: Great site for PRBI

name: Lauis Bantayan 2
notes: Finished 20 APCL and 20 PRBI!

name: Pantok 1
notes: Lots of soft coral

name: Sabang
notes: Less soft coral than Pantok. Seeing ENQD, but all with APML and none with PRBI!

name: Maslob
notes: Better coral than other sites, including some branching coral

name: Las Palmas
notes: Aborted because mostly sand

name: Saban 2
notes: Finished tanks from Las Palmas near area where we found 4 PRBI in Maslob

name: Tambak
notes: Tiring: against the current. Getting dark. Lots of soft coral. No PRBI, few anemones

name: Guadalupe MPA 1
notes: Missed the main tacot? Very difficult conditions: strong current, big waves, poor viz. Found 3 anems with APCL and spent almost whole tank collecting

name: Guadalupe MPA 2
notes: Beautiful table corals, big parrotfish, sweetlips, surgeonfish. Corals are very shallow.

name: Sto. Rosario MPA 1
notes: Near river outflow, very poor viz in places. Prevented us from circling the tacot and made following the reef very difficult. Low quality dive for searching for anemonefish. Spent most of the time trying to navigate. Reef we found was primarily deep (8-11 m)

name: Sto. Rosario MPA 2
notes: Patchy corals in sand, but primarily reef.

name: Badyan
notes: Reasonably continuous reef with coral cover as high as Sto. Rosario sites.

name: Ibarra
notes: Surge mixed mud into the water column: viz terrible. Hard to feel our way along. Probably no anemones or anemonefish here?

name: Tangkaan Beach 1
notes: Very difficult to assign fish to anemones once we caught them, since so many of each and the fish wander many meters

name: Tangkaan Beach 2
notes: So many anemones and so many anemonefish! If we want to find PRBI, we'll have to stop taking notes and just search.

name: Son-ok MPA
notes: MLP did some surveying, but in circles around GS as he collected.

name: Tangkaan MPA
notes: Survey (by MLP) was not in a straight line, other than initial 27 minutes at 18-25m depth. GPS buoy left at a PRBI anemone while we changd tanks (3 times). Focused on collecting PRBI, of which there were many.  Large contrat (in PRBI numbers) from nearby Tangaan Beach. Coral cover, and branching coral cover, much higher here.

name: Tangkaan Beach 3
notes: Slow to survey. So many anemones and anemonefish!

name: Didyo MPA 1
notes: At very beginning, a section of good branching and columnar coral where PRBI found. Need to trim out beginning nonlinear portion if this is to be used as a linear fish survey.

name: Didyo MPA 2
notes: Searching for PRBI in digitate branching and columnar corals (near where PRBI found on last dive). No swaths for fish/anemones. Lots of live coral, but evidence of destruction (overturned and broken coral heads).

name: Conalum
notes: Few anemones or fish. Getting dark. Viz lower than Quatros Islas.

name: Cabatoan MPA
notes: Coral heads on sand, 2m tall (dead). Coral quickly ended, leaving us on sand. Corals are shallow (1-4m) but offshore.

name: Palanas Outside
notes: All sand. Ended at the Prycegas boat terminal.

name: Palanas MPA
notes: These are the best corals in Albuera. None north of us. Corals almost all dead with some very small encrusting, branching, and massive corals. Corals are shallow but offshore. Many HECR.

name: Magbangon
notes: Corals only at beginning, then sand (with STHD and APPY). Missed corals from survey #64 because we were too close to shore (though the right depth). We overlapped the same section of shore towards the end.

name: Punta Lauis
notes: Coral quite good (much better than Albuera). Dive from shore, so doubled back at deepter depth (ended linear fish survey before doubling back)

name: Visca
notes: With Dr. Humberto Montes, Kenneth, Art, Shem (three VSU Marine Biology students). Corals damaged by periodic storms (rocks overturn) then recover.

name: Tamakin Gamai MPA
notes: Tiny tacot!

name: Tamakin Dacot
notes: Lots of rubble

name: Tabuk MPA 1
notes: Cookie from MENRO as dive guide

name: Tabuk MPA 2
notes: Mostly dead coral towards end of survey

name: Tabuk MPA 2
notes: Many massive corals. Good coral cover.

name: Liog-Liog
notes: Massive coral. Few anemones, despite much live coral (massive). Rudy Baldoza and Cookie (MENRO) also dove.

name: Buenavista
notes: Rudy Baldoza and Cookie (MENRO) also dove. Barren, dead coral, including areas of thick Diadema. Isabel smelting plant across the bay.

name: Kabgan
notes: Difficult navigation. Seemed to lose the main reef.

name: Macabog MPA
notes: Recovering corals after destructive fishing (trawling) was banned. Mostly dead. Corals are only shallow. Only a small area of corals.

name: Ipil MPA
notes: Bigger fish than Macabog. Only small area with corals.

name: Camp Downes MPA
notes: Coral area is very small. Not many more coral areas left in Ormoc. Most is sand and mud.

name: Lao River
notes: Mud! Mangroves onshore, near river outlets. Near border of Ormoc. In river outflow: top 50cm is turbid freshwater, then clearer below.

name: Linaw
notes: Coral area very small. Almost zero alive. Anti-MPA group (�Indacpan�?) is active here. We've now seen all the coral areas in Ormoc... no PRBI.

name: Damolog
notes: Lots of digitate branching corals. Bantay dagats brought us here for the corals, but our track appears to have passed the survey latitude (10.7635)

name: Bawo
notes: Lots of fine braching coral (thin). Realized I had lost the vial holder, so paused survey to look. Bantay dagats found it floating on the surface.

name: Tabonok
notes: Large, well-developed reef, no sand. Lots of coral. Started near Alegre Resort (private MPA). Getting dark towards end! Ended because of the light.

name: Damolog 2
notes: Started in front of bantay dagat HQ. Very high live coral cover in the shallows (<2m)

name: Alang-alang MPA
notes: Began at N side of MPA, swam S out of MPA. Big branching and tabular corals in MPA <3m, but no anemones. Swam deeper and found some anemones and fish at about 4m. Coral cover lower outside MPA. End 500m N or Daantabogon River. Shoreline is limestone cliff.

name: Moabug MPA and Outside
notes: Shoreline is limestone cliff. Strange benthic cover of branching algae. Coral head scattered around, all small.

name: Maslog MPA
notes: Almost all of survey was inside MPA. Mostly dead coral, with some soft coral.

name: Salag
notes: More green algae, as at Moabug #89. Limestone cliff shoreline. Many anemones and anemonefish! Ended because we hit 2 hrs.

name: Camow-buan
notes: This a proposed MPA. Patches of digitate branching corals.

name: Poblacion Tabogon
notes: This is a proposed MPA. Passed the Tagasa building where we're staying. Ended near the end of Survey #92.

name: Lapus-lapus
notes: Dive site. Soft coral in beginning, massive corals & rubble at end. Distant blasting heard, perhaps Gato Is. Strong currents.

name: Bantigue
notes: Scattered hard substrate wth mostly soft corals. Mostly sand. Densest corals at the beginning. Ended within sight of survey #94.

name: Dakit-dakit
notes: Coral in beginning, sand at end. Started at dive site near small rock stack at Malapascua's SW corner. High relief with good coral cover. Then headed SE and offshore of survey site (to find deeper water). Found sand and some coral substrate.

name: Bagay
notes: Distant from shore, but not tacot (apparently). Lots of massive, branching coral, and foliose corals, but very few fish of any kind. Feels like a ghost town. Many Diadema urchins. Distant blasts heard.

name: Bagay Tacot
notes: Started on patchy corals, but these ran out, leaving us on sand with very sparse corals. Saw a strange anemone (HECR?) that looked whithered.

name: Tuminhow
notes: Offshore ridge on the offshore side. Corals all deep (6+m). Lots of branching and massive corals. A fisherman recommended this spot for its corals. Saw a new spp of pipefish! Blasts very close (0.5 km).

name: Tabatongan
notes: Good live coral cover, many anemonefish. No corals deeper (all sand). GS saw 4 pipefish (not recorded on data sheet). MLP saw 3 pipefish (recorded).

name: Bagay 2
notes: 200m offshore. Saw a large (150cm) seasnake. Many ENQD but no PRBI.

name: Tuminhow 2
notes: Sand at beginning, branching and massive corals at end. Tried to find corals on tacot, but ended up on mostly sand until we hit the offshore slope (5-10m) with good corals near survey #99. Few anemones.
